intro: Biscutella laevigata var. queralbensis, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and smooth, hairless leaves. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
